snippet: Prosecutors have had “hours of discussion” in hopes of negotiating a plea in the case of a woman charged with visa fraud, the United States attorney’s office said.
abstract: Office of Preet Bharara, United States attorney in Manhattan, says in court papers that prosecutors had engaged in hours of discussion in the hope of negotiating a plea with Indian diplomat Devyani Khobragade, but that she has not responded; Khobragade's recent arrest in New York, in which she was charged with fraudulently obtaining a visa for a housekeeper, has generated outcry in India.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors have had “hours of discussion” in hopes of negotiating a plea in the case of a woman charged with visa fraud, the United States attorney’s office said.

headline.main: U.S. Outlines Efforts to Reach Plea With Indian Diplomat
headline.print_headline: U.S. Outlines Efforts to Reach Plea With Indian Diplomat
